channel.title: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help
channel.description:
I would like a list of all of them, but its not why I posted this. i would like to know what this one is [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/24nmyox.png[/img].
Now my second question is how do I add kdr in the text handler? I got the kills and deaths added, but I'm not sure about how going about doing this I tried "+c.kdr+", "+kdr+", and "c.+kdr+" but none of these worked, so I'll be glad if you guys can help me out.

item.title: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:17, topic:534053”]public double kdr = (double) kills / (double) deaths; c.sendQuest("KDR: @yel@" + c.kdr + "", 7343);[/quote]
Thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help

item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

sk8rdude461:

MrFun, what color do you want? Because you can just compile it in there…

I think what I’m asking is making the text that color and making it bold. Sorry for what I said before

Read full topic

item.title: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

Null Amount:

Okay, show me what your Kill/Death looks like, or just link me to the tutorial you used.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,496307.msg3628335.html#msg3628335

sk8rdude461:

Make sure method391 is being called properly in the client.

That has nothing to do with what i’m look for…the @color@ what I want is not in there

Read full topic

item.title: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:534053”]Again, it’s client dependant.
All those you must do
@red@ or @yel@, etc.
Search your client folder for @red@
You should get results in a file that isn’t your client.java, in one of them that will be where your colors are.
Mine, personally, are handled like <col=FF00FF>[/quote]

public int method391(String s, int i) { if(i >= 0) aBoolean1484 = !aBoolean1484; if(s.equals("red")) return 0xff0000; if(s.equals("gre")) return 65280; if(s.equals("blu")) return 255; if(s.equals("yel")) return 0xffff00; if(s.equals("cya")) return 65535; if(s.equals("mag")) return 0xff00ff; if(s.equals("whi")) return 0xffffff; if(s.equals("bla")) return 0; if(s.equals("lre")) return 0xff9040; if(s.equals("dre")) return 0x800000; if(s.equals("dbl")) return 128; if(s.equals("or1")) return 0xffb000; if(s.equals("or2")) return 0xff7000; if(s.equals("or3")) return 0xff3000; if(s.equals("gr1")) return 0xc0ff00; if(s.equals("gr2")) return 0x80ff00; if(s.equals("gr3")) return 0x40ff00; if(s.equals("xxx")) return 0x33CCFF; if(s.equals("str")) aBoolean1499 = true; if(s.equals("end")) aBoolean1499 = false; return -1; }
This is what i found in the
"Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4.java"

I tried all of these

Read full topic
item.source: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help

item.title: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Again, it’s client dependant.
All those you must do
@red@ or @yel@, etc.
Search your client folder for @red@
You should get results in a file that isn’t your client.java, in one of them that will be where your colors are.
Mine, personally, are handled like <col=FF00FF>

Read full topic
item.source: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help

item.title: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

Null Amount:

Post the exact line that you’ve tried adding in. Is there even a kdr var in your Client class?

To be honest…probly not. All I have is the command from that one tut on adding kills, deaths, and kdr with commands for pk points, which was dumb. So heres the command for the kdr

if (command.startsWith("kdr") && playerRights >= 0) { if (deaths == 0) { yell("" +playerName+ " has " +kills+ " kills and is undefeated"); } else { double kdr = ((double)kills)/((double)deaths); yell("" +playerName+ " has " +kills+ " kills and " +deaths+ " deaths"); yell("" +playerName+ "'s kdr is " +kdr+ "."); } }

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:534053”][quote author=MrFun link=topic=652849.msg4374371#msg4374371 date=1381642573]

Wouldn’t it be sendFrame126(“Players K/D Ratio”+ kdr, lineNumber);
?

This is texthandler…

It would look like that but what ever I put in “here” nothing works

It’s in your client. Search @red@ or something in client.java
You should get a full list, and you can make custom ones.

yea its not there i tried all of them…I’m looking for the bold orange one
[/quote]
I don’t use delta, so I’d have no idea…

Found this in my RSFont.java (Renamed client):

private int getColorByName(String s) { if(s.equals("369"))//color code, use as @###@ return 0x336699;//hex code if(s.equals("mon")) return 0x00ff80; if(s.equals("red")) return 0xff0000; if(s.equals("gre")) return 65280; if(s.equals("blu")) return 255; if(s.equals("yel")) return 0xffff00; if(s.equals("cya")) return 65535; if(s.equals("mag")) return 0xff00ff; if(s.equals("whi")) return 0xffffff; if(s.equals("bla")) return 0; if(s.equals("lre")) return 0xff9040; if(s.equals("dre")) return 0x800000; if(s.equals("dbl")) return 128; if(s.equals("or1")) return 0xffb000; if(s.equals("or2")) return 0xff7000; if(s.equals("or3")) return 0xff3000; if(s.equals("gr1")) return 0xc0ff00; if(s.equals("gr2")) return 0x80ff00; if(s.equals("gr3")) return 0x40ff00; if(s.equals("str")) aBoolean1499 = true; if(s.equals("end")) aBoolean1499 = false; return -1; }[/quote]
Thanks for your help but I tried all of these and no luck

Read full topic
item.source: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help

item.title: Delta @?@ Colors and text handler help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:6, topic:534053”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=652849.msg4374370#msg4374370 date=1381642202]
Wouldn’t it be sendFrame126(“Players K/D Ratio”+ kdr, lineNumber);
?
[/quote]
This is texthandler…

It would look like that but what ever I put in “here” nothing works

It’s in your client. Search @red@ or something in client.java
You should get a full list, and you can make custom ones.

yea its not there i tried all of them…I’m looking for the bold orange one[/quote]
I don’t use delta, so I’d have no idea…

Found this in my RSFont.java (Renamed client):

private int getColorByName(String s) { if(s.equals("369"))//color code, use as @###@ return 0x336699;//hex code if(s.equals("mon")) return 0x00ff80; if(s.equals("red")) return 0xff0000; if(s.equals("gre")) return 65280; if(s.equals("blu")) return 255; if(s.equals("yel")) return 0xffff00; if(s.equals("cya")) return 65535; if(s.equals("mag")) return 0xff00ff; if(s.equals("whi")) return 0xffffff; if(s.equals("bla")) return 0; if(s.equals("lre")) return 0xff9040; if(s.equals("dre")) return 0x800000; if(s.equals("dbl")) return 128; if(s.equals("or1")) return 0xffb000; if(s.equals("or2")) return 0xff7000; if(s.equals("or3")) return 0xff3000; if(s.equals("gr1")) return 0xc0ff00; if(s.equals("gr2")) return 0x80ff00; if(s.equals("gr3")) return 0x40ff00; if(s.equals("str")) aBoolean1499 = true; if(s.equals("end")) aBoolean1499 = false; return -1; }

Read full topic
